nodes.bodyText: This winds up creating a new List object for each iteration, and creates a loop that can simply be unrolled to what is originally there.  Yes, it's two more lines of code but a lot less VM work.

This reduces the readability.  The if block makes it clear that there is one path for contract creation and one for normal transactions.  Without that you need to have deep knowledge of the transactions that a contract creation TX lacks a to field.  I don't mind the common field refactoring but I think the over-use of optional here reduces the accessibility to future maintainers.
